title: Social Media Accounts Sold To Under-16s To Bypass Ban | 10 News+
description: 10 News+ has investigated the various loopholes Australian kids are using to beat the social media ban. We found that it only takes a simple online search to find a black market for social media accounts up for sale. There are dedicated websites aimed at children locked out by the nationwide ban, with the price tag ranging from just $50 to thousands. However, cyber safety expert Susan McLean told 10 News+ that buyers should be cautious. She warns the accounts for sale could just be the work of scammers out to make a quick buck from teenagers. title: US To Order Social Media Checks, Sydney Shopping Centre Brawl, Oscar Piastri's Big Payday | 10 News+
description: 10 News+ has investigated the various loopholes Australian kids are using to beat the social media ban. We found that it only takes a simple online search to find a black market for social media accounts up for sale. There are dedicated websites aimed at children locked out by the nationwide ban, with the price tag ranging from just $50 to thousands. However, cyber safety expert Susan McLean told 10 News+ that buyers should be cautious. She warns the accounts for sale could just be the work of scammers out to make a quick buck from teenagers.  Oscar Piastri is set to receive a $41 million bonus, on top of his $15 million salary. However, he’s not the highest-paid driver. Max Verstappen leads the list with a $114 million payday for the year. Lando Norris is in second place, raking in $86 million. Lewis Hamilton is in third place, followed by Piastri at number four.  Anthony Albanese was bombarded by questions from journalists about multiple MPs’ taxpayer-funded travel expenses, at a tense press conference that was supposed to be about the government’s social media ban. The Prime Minister struggled to control the scene and avoid a pile-on from journalists, but the press conference turned testy multiple times as he fielded follow-on questions from media outlets.  After 40 years, ‘Neighbours’ will air for the final time, again. The beloved soap opera was first axed in the 80s, then again in 2022, before being resurrected a second time. The revival was short-lived, so Georgie Tunny is taking a look back at the iconic Australian show for 10 News+.
